official-title.#text: To provide for the extension of certain unemployment benefits.

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Emergency Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Emergency Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 2. Extension of emergency unemployment compensation program.
Sec. 3. Temporary extension of extended benefit provisions.

Sec. 4. Extension of funding for reemployment services and reemployment and eligibility assessment
			 activities.
Sec. 5. Additional extended unemployment benefits under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act.
Sec. 6. Flexibility for unemployment program agreements.
Sec. 7. Ending unemployment payments to jobless millionaires and billionaires.
Sec. 8. GAO study on the use of work suitability requirements in unemployment insurance programs.
Sec. 10. Extension of customs user fees.

header.#text:
Extension of funding for reemployment services and reemployment and eligibility assessment
			 activities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 4004(c)(2)(A) of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008

text.#text: The amendment made by this subsection shall take effect as if included in the enactment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new sentence:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 4001(i)(1)(A) of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(first tier benefits) and, if
			 applicable, again within a time period (determined appropriate by the
			 Secretary) after the date the individual begins to receive amounts under

quoted-block-continuation-text.#text:
At a minimum, such reemployment services and reemployment and eligibility assessment activities
			 shall be provided to an individual within a time period (determined
			 appropriate by the Secretary) after the date the individual begins to
			 receive amounts under

text.#text:
The amendment made by this subsection shall apply on and after the date of the enactment of this
			 Act.

The purposes of the reemployment services and reemployment and eligibility assessment activities
			 under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 4001(i) of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008

text.#text:
to better link the unemployed with the overall workforce system by bringing individuals receiving
			 unemployment insurance benefits in for personalized assessments and
			 referrals to reemployment services; and

to provide individuals receiving unemployment insurance benefits with early access to specific
			 strategies that can help get them back into the workforce faster,
			 including through—
the development of a reemployment plan;
the provision of access to relevant labor market information;

the provision of access to information about industry-recognized credentials that are regionally
			 relevant or nationally portable;
the provision of referrals to reemployment services and training; and
an assessment of the individual's on-going eligibility for unemployment insurance benefits.

header.#text: Ending unemployment payments to jobless millionaires and billionaires

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no Federal funds may be used for payments of
			 unemployment compensation under the emergency unemployment compensation
			 program under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to an individual whose adjusted
			 gross income in the preceding year was equal to or greater than
			 $1,000,000.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: title IV of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008

text.#text:
Unemployment insurance applications shall include a form or procedure for an individual applicant
			 to certify the individual’s adjusted gross income was not equal to or
			 greater than $1,000,000 in the preceding year.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Emergency Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2014/s:7/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: applies with respect to an individual.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Emergency Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2014/s:7/ss:a

text.#text:
It is the duty of the States to verify the residency, employment, legal, and income status of
			 applicants for unemployment insurance and no Federal funds may be expended
			 for purposes of determining whether or not the prohibition under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply to weeks of unemployment beginning on or after the
			 date of the enactment of this Act.

header.#text: GAO study on the use of work suitability requirements in unemployment insurance programs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a study on the use of work suitability
			 requirements to strengthen requirements to ensure that unemployment
			 insurance benefits are being provided to individuals who are actively
			 looking for work and who truly want to return to the labor force. Such
			 study shall include an analysis of—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

text.#text:
how work suitability requirements work under both State and Federal unemployment insurance
			 programs; and
how to incorporate and improve such requirements under Federal unemployment insurance programs; and
other items determined appropriate by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Comptroller General of the
			 United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: on the ongoing study required under

. Such briefing shall include preliminary recommendations
			 for such legislation and administrative action as the
